intro: Hieracium pindigena, commonly known as the Pindus hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is adapted to harsh alpine conditions. It produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium pindigena is often found in meadows and grasslands at high altitudes, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
